title: Are Bluetooth and wireless headphones compatible with PS4? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have seen some that are but also there are bluetooth adaptors that makes most compatible with it. The reason is the band that Sony uses in their native bluetooth. The most common is the A2DP and that lags around 100–200ms during gameplay.

Wireless Sony headphones are compatible but if you want to use any other brand, you have to purchase a small connector sort of device (you can search Google for it and find it easily on Amazon) which can help you connect your headphones to the PS4.

Bluetooth headphones should be compatible no problem since the PS4 is Bluetooth compatible and wireless headphones shouldn’t be an Issue either because they come with an adapter to make them work on most things with USB ports.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Cj Jackson and Ali Salman

response.answer_text: Both Bluetooth and wireless headphones are compatible with PS4, which is no problem. But not all Bluetooth and wireless headphones are compatible. If you want to find the best headphones compatible with PS4, you can read this article: best headphones compatible with PS4
